docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 2.--The delay in ratification of the Colompian treaty for a settlement of differences between the United States and Colombia arising from the creation of the independence of Panama, has been most unfortunate in its bearing on...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 2.--The delay in ratification of the Colompian treaty for a settlement of differences between the United States and Colombia arising from the creation of the independence of Panama, has been most unfortunate in its bearing on American relations with South America in the opinion of Bainbridge Colby, the retiring Secretary of State.
docs.abstract: Dinner in Washington addressed by Sec Colby

headline.main: COLOMBIA DISPUTE COSTLY, SAYS COLBY; Delay in Ratification of Treaty a Calamity for Our South American Relations. SOME WAR TRADE HARMFUL Must Restore Confidence to Prevent Return of Latin Countries to Old European Markets.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: REPORTS of a continuance of liquidation are still current, and they are supported by the number of business failures shown in the bankruptcy courts.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 5.--Except for a conference wvith Secretaries Hughes, Denby and Weeks on the Panama situation, another with Senator Lodge and Representative Mondell on the coming extra session and a third with Elmer Dover over the reorganization of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 5.--Except for a conference wvith Secretaries Hughes, Denby and Weeks on the Panama situation, another with Senator Lodge and Representative Mondell on the coming extra session and a third with Elmer Dover over the reorganization of the Republican National Committee, Warren G. Harding's first day as President was occcupied mainly in familiarizing himself with the routine of his office.
docs.abstract: how he took up game related by Sen Hale; is best golfer among Presidents

headline.main: HARDING BEGINS WORK WITH VIM; Spends First Day as President in Office Routine and Conferences. GETS AIREDALE AS MASCOT Receives the National Committeemen--Attends a MusicalComedy at Night.
